useLalaHelp: Connect to SENEC appliance via local network. This requires access to local monitoring.
activeControlHelp: lala.cgi connection reuquired! When activated it is possible to control SENEC appliance via 'control' datapoints. You accept any potential risks incurred by activating this option possibly including loss of warranty.
IPHelp: Here you enter the IP or FQDN of your SENEC System
PollIntervalHelp: Here you can define the polling interval for high priority data [min 1, max 3600 seconds]. Default = 10.
PollIntervalLowHelp: Here you can define the polling interval for low priority data [min 10, max 3600 minutes]. Default = 60.
RequestTimeoutHelp: Heare you define the request timeout when polling from SENEC [min 1000, max 100000]. Default = 5000.
PollRetriesHelp: Here you enter how often you want the adapter to retry polling in case of error [min 0, max 999]. 0 = never, 999 = unlimited. Default = 10.
PollRetryFactorHelp: Here you enter how you want to space retries apart of each other. n'th retry will happen after Interval * Multiplier * n seconds. [min 1, max 10]. Default = 2.
HighPrioDataPointsDisclaimer: I hereby acknowledge that it is in my very own responsibility alone to ensure these settings are valid. I also acknowledge that problematic settings can cause my SENEC appliance to malfunction and that I willingly accept these risks.
HighPrioDataPointsDisclaimerHelp: Wrong settings or even requesting too many datapoints can cause the SENEC appliance to reboot, malfunction and other undesired behavior. If you don't understand what these settings are or how to properly configure them, please leave them all empty!
HighPrioBMSHelp: Auto-Added: CELL_TEMPERATURES_MODULE_A, CELL_TEMPERATURES_MODULE_B, CELL_TEMPERATURES_MODULE_C, CELL_TEMPERATURES_MODULE_D, CELL_VOLTAGES_MODULE_A, CELL_VOLTAGES_MODULE_B, CELL_VOLTAGES_MODULE_C, CELL_VOLTAGES_MODULE_D, CURRENT, SOC, SYSTEM_SOC, TEMP_MAX, TEMP_MIN, VOLTAGE
HighPrioENERGYHelp: Auto-Added: STAT_STATE, GUI_BAT_DATA_POWER, GUI_INVERTER_POWER, GUI_HOUSE_POW, GUI_GRID_POW, GUI_BAT_DATA_FUEL_CHARGE, GUI_CHARGING_INFO, GUI_BOOSTING_INFO, GUI_BAT_DATA_POWER, GUI_BAT_DATA_VOLTAGE, GUI_BAT_DATA_CURRENT, GUI_BAT_DATA_FUEL_CHARGE, GUI_BAT_DATA_OA_CHARGING, STAT_LIMITED_NET_SKEW, SAFE_CHARGE_FORCE, SAFE_CHARGE_PROHIBIT, SAFE_CHARGE_RUNNING
HighPrioPMOBJHelp: Auto-Added: FREQ, U_AC, I_AC, P_AC, P_TOTAL
USE_SENEC_API_HELP: Check if the adapter shall make use of the SENEC API.
Email-Help: Email-Address used to login to mein-senec.de
Password_Help:: Password used to login to mein-senec.de
PollIntervalAPIHelp: Here you can define the polling interval [min 3, max 1440 minutes]. Default = 5. SENEC updates API Data every 5 minutes.
RebuildHistoryHelp: Check this if you want the adapter to rebuild history values back to date of installation.
